definition: Mt Tai 泰山[Tai4 Shan1] in Shandong/abbr. for Thailand
cool and collected (idiom); showing no sign of nerves/perfectly composed
to handle the situation calmly (idiom)/unruffled/to treat the situation lightly
see 泰然處之|泰然处之[tai4 ran2 chu3 zhi1]

sentences.english: And rest serene beneath its tranquil power.
sentences.chinese: 使我在它安靜的力量下泰然休憩。

sentences.english: No, she would have taken it calmly, and found pleasures therein.
sentences.chinese: 不會，她只會泰然處之，而且還要從中找到樂趣。

sentences.english: She always stays cool, calm and collected in a crisis.
sentences.chinese: 她在危急關頭總是很冷靜鎮定，處之泰然。

sentences.english: The bourgeois talked peaceably to the working-classes of what was in preparation.
sentences.chinese: 資產階級泰然自若地和工人們談論着正在準備中的事。

sentences.english: It remains unclear if Apple Computer, poised to launch its line of Intel-powered Macintoshes next year.
sentences.chinese: 他剩餘不明白的如果蘋果電腦泰然自若下水。

sentences.english: Later, only to learn from Ann, calm.
sentences.chinese: 往後，唯有學着自安，泰然。

sentences.english: This sangfroid could be tested by several threats.
sentences.chinese: 這種泰然自若的姿態要經受多種威脅的考驗。

sentences.english: He remained unruffled by the charges.
sentences.chinese: 他受到這些指控仍處之泰然。

sentences.english: They'll readily defend their beliefs in civics class .
sentences.chinese: 他們泰然自若地在公民學課上爲自己的信念辯護。

sentences.english: You must learn to play it cool.
sentences.chinese: 你必須學會遇事泰然處之。

sentences.english: Photography, however, is poised on a fine borderline between documentary and art.
sentences.chinese: 然而，攝影在記錄與藝術的邊界中泰然自若。

sentences.english: But Hester ought long ago to have done with this injustice.
sentences.chinese: 但海絲特早就應該對這種不公乎處之泰然了。
於我上方高處，泰然自若。

sentences.english: But other days, I took it in stride.
sentences.chinese: 但是我轉念一想，就能泰然處之。

sentences.english: Nobody can imperturbable acceptance of the inevitable.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人能夠泰然的接受不可避免的事。

sentences.english: Granddaughterly." It's a role she occupies with great ease.
sentences.chinese: 像孫女一樣“這是她泰然處之的一個角色。

definition: cool and collected (idiom); showing no sign of nerves/perfectly composed
see 泰然處之|泰然处之[tai4 ran2 chu3 zhi1]
to handle the situation calmly (idiom)/unruffled/to treat the situation lightly
to remain calm in the face of events (idiom)
bear hardship with equanimity/regard wrongdoing with equanimity
lit. to hold the pearl of wisdom (idiom)/fig. to be endowed with extraordinary intelligence
quiet and contented/indifferent to fame or gain
